page.title: 18Allotments in Ferryhill
page.content: When Ferryhill expanded during the early years of the century the individual houses did not have gardens attached so open areas were made available for allotments.These are still in existence(many have passed down through families) and are rented annually from the Town Council.Their existence has led to the development of two typical North-Eastern pastimes. {Pigeon Racing}Popular in most mining communities this still thrives in the Ferryhill area.The birds are raced over various distances including cross Channel races from France and Belgium. {Leek Growing}The leeks are grown for competition rather than for eating purposes.Every Autumn there are shows in each of the many pubs and clubs to see who has managed to grow the largest leek.As an incentive there are attractive cash prizes.
